62365.name: Dishcloth Mitts
62365.notes_html:
Quick and easy mitts made with Peaches & Creme, 100% cotton yarn that is made in North Carolina!
I have made lots of dishcloths and one night I thought I would try a mitt pattern with the yarn. My mother is in a wheelchair and while I made her lots of the popular fingerless mitts in other yarns, they just didn’t hold up with the daily washings. When you are confined to a wheelchair, your hands take lots of abuse from turning the wheels. These mitts are just what she needed. I even make them for myself since my hands freeze when I am at the computer, especially in the summer with air conditioning. Try a pair! You can wash them daily, and they only shrink a tad. Great for bazaars or gifts.

1059854.name: Groovy Face Mask Lanyards
1059854.notes_html:
UPDATE: The entire staff of my school (K-8) are wearing these on their masks and seem to love them! Make one for your child’s teacher!!
****

Did you see that picture on Facebook with the mask on the bathroom floor? I did and it freaked me out. I’m a teacher and I just knew I could do something about this problem.

Here is the Groovy Face Mask Lanyard. So easy to make - it is one row of mostly single crochet. Sew on a button and let your mask hang from your neck instead when it is not needed.

I used cotton yarn to ensure that it would be simple and easily washed.

The pattern has detailed instructions plus a quick by the numbers version as well as one where you don’t have to count stitches. I used craft thread to sew the buttons on.

Please let me know if you have any questions or comments on the pattern! Thanks and don’t forget to post your completed projects!

Stay well!

1071789.name: Knitt Ear Saver
1071789.gauge_description: 16 stitches and 10 rows = 4 inches in double crochet
1071789.notes_html:
·Knitt Ear Saver PATTERN·

The Knitt Ear Saver has been inspired in covid-19 times, where we have to wear a mask for many hours a day and it helps us for not to have more ears pain due to elastic cords of the face masks. It is so cozy and easy to wear.

DIGITAL DOWNLOAD
Adaptative size
Crochet Pattern
Pattern written in US terms  and Spanish

PATTERN COPYRIGHT: 

This pattern if for personal use only. You may not sell or share it under any circumstances. You may sell finished products made from this pattern.

Then when you have them done share the pictures with #knittearsaver and tag me on Instagram @knitt.handmade, I would love to see your ears savers done and we could share your pics too.

If you have any questions while you are knitting this pattern, please do not hesitate in asking me at etsy.com/es/shop/KnittHandmade, send us an e-mail to knitthandmade@gmail.com or contact me on Instagram @knitt.handmade

Thank you for visiting my little shop and enjoy this cute knitting pattern

pattern_author.name: Julia Pradas
pattern_author.notes:
My name is Julia Pradas, I am a knitter since 2013 and I am part of Knitt Handmade. I have been designing patterns and now is the moment to share all my ideas and creations with this amazing knitting and crochet community. 

All my patterns are inspired in mountains and winter. I do love living in between mountains and I find many things that give me ideas to design new beanies.

Knitt Handmade is about two friends knitting since 2015 around the world, being inspired by all the new things that we learn on our trips. 

Always using local products when possible and meeting knitters all around the world. 


I hope you enjoy them!! 

Follow us on Instagram and Facebook to stay tuned.

1091183.name: Completely Hooked Lanyard
1091183.sizes_available: One size (21"/53.34cm long) or your choice: easily adjusted as you go.
1091183.notes_html:
A PDF version of this pattern is emailed as part of a Holiday Shopping Guide for members of the Crochet Guild of America (CGOA), as of December 1, 2020.

This pattern doubles as a versatile template: borrow individual elements from it to pair with your own favorite cord pattern and turn it into a hook-only lanyard.

A reversible crochet lanyard attaches to each ear loop of a face mask with 100% crocheted fasteners. No sewing on buttons or metal hardware.

Wear the lanyard around your neck. If you remove your mask, there it hangs, already found, like wearing reading glasses on a chain.

The chain loop end attaches with a lark’s head knot. The other end has a crocheted peg-like “shank” button. It loops around the other ear loop and buttons into a stitch space of the lanyard. This makes the length easy to adjust. The mask loops can be any thickness.
1091183.notes:
*A PDF version of this pattern is emailed as part of a Holiday Shopping Guide for members of the Crochet Guild of America ([CGOA][1]), as of December 1, 2020.*

This pattern doubles as a versatile template: borrow individual elements from it to pair with your own favorite cord pattern and turn it into a hook-only lanyard.

A reversible crochet lanyard attaches to each ear loop of a face mask with 100% crocheted fasteners. No sewing on buttons or metal hardware.

Wear the lanyard around your neck. If you remove your mask, there it hangs, already found, like wearing reading glasses on a chain.

The chain loop end attaches with a lark’s head knot. The other end has a crocheted peg-like “shank” button. It loops around the other ear loop and buttons into a stitch space of the lanyard. This makes the length easy to adjust. The mask loops can be any thickness.


  [1]: https://www.crochet.org/?

pattern_author.name: Vashti Braha
pattern_author.notes:
I love to promote crochet as many things: an art, hobby, learning tool, and practical medium. I do this with [designs][1] and [classes][2]. For [my newsletter][3] I try to write about what I don’t see others writing about crochet.

Magazine editors have described my design style as "breezy". Maybe that comes from living and working in a subtropical paradise. Peacocks roam freely in our neighborhood. 

I grew up in Wisconsin, so the natural world I encounter here in Florida is always new and fascinating. 

New: I have a [Linktree][4].

Even newer: I moved out of Florida in 2021 and now live in the mountains just outside of Asheville, North Carolina. 


  [1]: https://designingvashti.com/product-category/vashti-braha-crochet-patterns/
  [2]: https://designingvashti.com/learn/vashti-crochet-classes/
  [3]: https://designingvashti.com/newsletter/
  [4]: https://linktr.ee/designingvashti

Crocheting now in the North Carolina mountains omg :slightly_smiling_face: 
For 2022 I'm teaching online crochet classes for CGOA!

Here's a [Linktree][1].

> **Crochet Manifesto**
>
> **I work to help protect crochet from being limited by
> misconceptions and stereotypes**.
> Crochet is vastly varied and versatile. I
> have to look hard for its *true*
> limits. Crochet is still underestimated.
> 
> Few researchers recognize crochet, know what to look
> for, why it matters, or even know what
> it is. It's a problem with our history, and with today's
> crochet too. County fair judges sometimes
> disqualify a crocheted entry by mistake because it doesn't match their
> preconceived idea of what crochet is. :open_mouth: 
> 
> Crochet is a thinking medium for me. It's mathematical, philosophical,
> theoretical, practical, powerfully syncretic, and expressive. 
> 
> **This is where my [designs][2], [newsletters][3], and
> [class topics][4] come from**. It's why I've
> been working with Crochet Guild of
> America (CGOA) to develop their
> [Masters Programs][5].

**ABOUT MY [CROCHET PATTERNS][6]**
- **Patterns include both US and UK terms** for crochet stitches, project measurements, and yarn weights.
- **Do you like to crochet things to sell?** It's great that my designs inspire you to make and sell the finished items. I'm adding this statement to each new self-published patterns but it applies to all of them even if you don't see it stated in an older pattern. 
- **Visit [Vashti's Crochet Lounge][7]** in Ravelry for pattern support and for just hanging with the crochet mellow for a spell.

The original [DesigningVashti website][8], and the *[Crochet Inspirations Newsletter][9]* went public in Fall 2010. Patterns labeled "DJC" are **[exclusive patterns][10] by [Doris Chan][11].**

users.about_me_html:
Crocheting now in the North Carolina mountains omg
For 2022 I’m teaching online crochet classes for CGOA!

Here’s a Linktree.

Crochet Manifesto

I work to help protect crochet from being limited by misconceptions and stereotypes. Crochet is vastly varied and versatile. I have to look hard for its true limits. Crochet is still underestimated.

Few researchers recognize crochet, know what to look for, why it matters, or even know what it is. It’s a problem with our history, and with today’s crochet too. County fair judges sometimes disqualify a crocheted entry by mistake because it doesn’t match their preconceived idea of what crochet is.

Crochet is a thinking medium for me. It’s mathematical, philosophical, theoretical, practical, powerfully syncretic, and expressive.

This is where my designs, newsletters, and class topics come from. It’s why I’ve been working with Crochet Guild of America (CGOA) to develop their Masters Programs.

ABOUT MY CROCHET PATTERNS

  • Patterns include both US and UK terms for crochet stitches, project measurements, and yarn weights.
  • Do you like to crochet things to sell? It’s great that my designs inspire you to make and sell the finished items. I’m adding this statement to each new self-published patterns but it applies to all of them even if you don’t see it stated in an older pattern.
  • Visit Vashti’s Crochet Lounge in Ravelry for pattern support and for just hanging with the crochet mellow for a spell.

The original DesigningVashti website, and the Crochet Inspirations Newsletter went public in Fall 2010. Patterns labeled “DJC” are exclusive patterns by Doris Chan.

1112336.name: Adaptive Adult Thumbless Mittens
1112336.notes_html:
These mittens were designed with the help of a woman I met on Facebook, who was looking for thumbless mittens for her daughter. Off-the-shelf mittens didn’t work for her daughter or allow her to drive her own wheelchair. These were designed according to her size recommendations for her daughter.

This is a beginner-friendly pattern with a couple of options for customization.

Final Size (Laid Flat)
Glove: 8 inches tall by 6 inches wide
Cuff: 4 inches tall by 3 inches wide.

I’ve added a bulky yarn version of this pattern, check it out here: https://www.ravelry.com/patterns/library/bulky-adaptive-thumbless-mittens

**This is a beginner-friendly pattern with a couple of options for customization.**

I've added a bulky yarn version of this pattern, check it out here: [https://www.ravelry.com/patterns/library/bulky-adaptive-thumbless-mittens][1]

1161119.notes_html: This pattern will knit to chunky weight yarn but I have found that doubling DK gives much better definition of the pattern than using single chunky weight yarn.
1161119.notes: This pattern will knit to chunky weight yarn but I have found that doubling DK gives much better definition of the pattern than using single chunky weight yarn.

1211443.name: Natvanter arthritis
1211443.gauge_description: 27 stitches and 40 rows = 4 inches in Textured pattern
1211443.notes_html:
Natvanter is the Danish word for “night mittens”. Natvanter are warm knitted mittens without a thumb. These mittens are suitable as sleeping mittens for arthritic hands.

The pattern is made for at yarn with a gauge of 27 stitches per 10 centimeters (textured pattern) i.e. a yardage of approximately 120 meters per 50 grams. Pictured in merino extrafine 120 from Hjertegarn.

The pattern includes directions for size S, M, L and XL with circumference (mitten) 23 (25, 27, 29) centimeters and a length of 25 (26, 28, 29) centimeters.

This an easy pattern written for a knitter who is familiar with knit, purl, increases and decreases (worked in the round), a knitter who is able to follow written instructions.

If you weave in the yarn ends neatly/invisible these mittens are 2 sided.

Materials: yarn, knitting needles and stitch markers.

The pattern does not include finished items yarn etc. The pattern only includes instruction for knitting the mittens.
1211443.notes:

users.about_me: I am an independent knitwear designer from Denmark with a master in mathematical economy. I grew up by the fjord wearing traditional Scandinavian knitwear knitted by my mother and grandmother. My mother also taught me how to knit and crochet when I was 5 years old.
users.about_me_html: I am an independent knitwear designer from Denmark with a master in mathematical economy. I grew up by the fjord wearing traditional Scandinavian knitwear knitted by my mother and grandmother. My mother also taught me how to knit and crochet when I was 5 years old.

1216026.name: Foot Cast Covers
1216026.gauge_description: 4 stitches and 1 row = 4 inches in 4 stitches per inch
1216026.notes_html:
I designed these Foot Cast Covers for fun at the request of a friend who recently broke her ankle. She wanted something colorful and happy, so these 2 designs were created. They are easy and fairly quick to make too! The finished size is 6” wide and 7” long.

Yarn: I Love This Yarn in Yellow, Black, Hot Rose, White
Red Heart Super Saver Stripes in Retro Stripe

Hook: 3.75mm/F hook, 4.5mm hook, 5mm/H hook

Supplies: stitch marker, tapestry needle, scissors, optional low temp
glue gun

users.about_me:
I have been retired for several years. Retirement has been wonderful for me...I can crochet and create anytime I like!
 A few years ago I severely injured both ankles and legs. I was unable to walk for 6 months,.... followed by 2 months of physical therapy. During that time I crocheted! Seems like out of the blue, people were requesting that I make something for them. It brought back my crochet skills and pushed me to learn more stitches and techniques.  That's when I discovered, that I love making dolls! I started making Big Head Dolls with different hats.
Last April, I began writing and publishing my own patterns. My first doll design was the Puddin Doll, named after my mom. I have fun designing new outfits for Puddin..... She has quite a large selection of outfits for every season of the year!

Since then, I have designed several dolls, each one named after someone in my family. The challenge of designing new outfits and dolls is something I really enjoy! It's a time for me to play and have fun! Although I must admit, I'm much better at crocheting than I am at typing! Luckily for me, I have some awesome testers that keep me on my toes! All of my patterns have been tested by at least 3-4 testers. If you find a problem please let me know.

You can find my designs on Facebook at: Sandy's Country Crochet & Crafts OR Nutshell Lane Studio

1293190.name: Love Ukraine: extra thick cast cover
1293190.gauge_description: 13 stitches and 18 rows = 4 inches in stockinette stitch
1293190.notes_html:
This pattern is for cast sock covers. It is intended to keep the person who has a cast on their leg warm, therefore I recommend using thick wool or thick wool blend. At the moment button-up cast covers are desperately needed by injured Ukrainian soldiers. Many knitters are making warm items to donate to the Ukrainian army, as at this moment warm knits are super, super needed there, winters there are harsh.

Here you can read about why this pattern is here, why it matters and why it is saving lives (in English):
https://eng.lsm.lv/article/society/society/another-knitti...

And (in Latvian):
https://www.lsm.lv/raksts/zinas/latvija/aicina-adit-attai...

Many thanks to Daiga Valkovska for sharing her knowledge regarding the sizing for these cast cover button-up socks! Here is her video (in Latvian) regarding the sizing:
https://youtu.be/P1U7djhsw0k

I have done my best to create an easy-to-read, easy-to-follow, row-by-row knitting pattern. If there is a stitch or a technique you are not familiar with, please look it up on youtube. I have provided some links, but please look up other videos if you need more help.
The pattern is row by row, but I have also provided measurements in case your row gauge is slightly different.

The pattern is row by row, but I have also provided measurements in case your row gauge is slightly different.

1297329.name: Communication Mitts
1297329.sizes_available: Three adult sizes: Sm/Md (in green), L/XL (in yellow), and stretchy One-Size-Fits-Most (in red with broken rib st)
1297329.gauge_description: 24 stitches and 32 rows = 4 inches in stockinette
1297329.notes_html:
Overwhelm is something most of us experience from time to time.
For some of us it takes much longer to process overwhelm than others.

Often I need to withdraw for a few hours to a solitary silent nonverbal retreat from speaking aloud to just ‘be’ and ‘do’ without the often heavy effort and burden of sporadically conversing.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Selective_Mutism
You can see how conveying this need to my partner when it arises may be problematic, ‘eh?

Enter ‘Communication Mitts.’
For anyone who would simply like to let those surrounding you know when you are feeling charged, stable, or low battery.

This is the first of several patterns that I plan to release on this topic of mental health communication tools.
For future ones to appear in your ‘Your Pattern Highlights’ feed, favorite my Designer page.

This pattern design in US knit terms may not be distributed or sold as your own, but feel free to sell a finished item made from it.

S I Z E S
• Three adult sizes: Sm/Md (in green), L/XL (in yellow), and stretchy One-Size-Fits-Most (in red with broken rib st)

T E C H N I Q U E S
• get gauge, knit flat, c/o = cast on, st = stitch, sl = slip, k = knit, p = purl, pm = place marker, sm = slip marker(s), m1r = make one right increase, m1l = make one left increase, intarsia, read a color stitch chart, k2tog = knit 2 together decrease, kfb = knit front-and-back increase, p/u = pick up sts, stretchy b/o = bind off

Y A R N S
• SanctuaryWool.com Homestead Wool and Gift Farm rescue alpaca blend worsted
• Lily Sugar ‘n Cream worsted in red, yellow, green, and warm brown

N E E D L E S
• size US #3 3.25mm double pointed needles or close size to get gauge

N O T I O N S
• stitch holder for thumb stitches, stitch markers

G A U G E
• 4”x4” = 24 sts across x 32 sts down in stockinette

Feel free to reach out anytime with pattern questions (not Google-able technique questions) and I’ll typically get back to you within 24 hours.

Warmly,
Stace
1297329.notes:
Overwhelm is something most of us experience from time to time.  
For some of us it takes much longer to process overwhelm than others.

Often I need to withdraw for a few hours to a solitary silent nonverbal retreat from speaking aloud to just 'be' and 'do' without the often heavy effort and burden of sporadically conversing. 
[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Selective_Mutism][1]
You can see how conveying this need to my partner when it arises may be problematic, 'eh?

Enter 'Communication Mitts.'
For anyone who would simply like to let those surrounding you know when you are feeling **charged**, **stable**, or **low battery**.

This is the first of several patterns that I plan to release on this topic of **mental health communication tools**.  
For future ones to appear in your 'Your Pattern Highlights' feed, favorite my Designer page.

This pattern design in US knit terms may not be distributed or sold as your own, but feel free to sell a finished item made from it.

S I Z E S
    • Three adult sizes: Sm/Md (in green), L/XL (in yellow), and stretchy One-Size-Fits-Most (in red with broken rib st)

T E C H N I Q U E S
    • get gauge, knit flat, c/o = cast on, st = stitch, sl = slip, k = knit, p = purl, pm = place marker, sm = slip marker(s), m1r = make one right increase, m1l = make one left increase, intarsia, read a color stitch chart, k2tog = knit 2 together decrease, kfb = knit front-and-back increase, p/u = pick up sts, stretchy b/o = bind off

Y A R N S
    • [SanctuaryWool.com][2] Homestead Wool and Gift Farm rescue alpaca blend worsted
    • Lily Sugar ‘n Cream worsted in red, yellow, green, and warm brown

N E E D L E S
    • size US #3 3.25mm double pointed needles or close size to get gauge

N O T I O N S
    • stitch holder for thumb stitches, stitch markers

G A U G E
    • 4”x4” = 24 sts across x 32 sts down in stockinette

Feel free to reach out anytime with pattern questions (not Google-able technique questions) and I'll typically get back to you within 24 hours.

Warmly,
Stace

  [1]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Selective_mutism
  [2]: https://sanctuarywool.com

packs.yarn_name: SanctuaryWool.com Homestead Yarn and Gift Shop: Alpaca Blend light worsted
packs.personal_name: SanctuaryWool.com Homestead Yarn and Gift Shop: Alpaca Blend light worsted

pattern_author.name: Stacy Pamela
pattern_author.notes:
--
Click '❤️ save in favorites' here to have a Designer's patterns appear in your feed found when you click 'Menu,' then 'Patterns,' then scroll down to 'Your Pattern Highlights.'

![image alt text][1]
[indiesellersguild.org][2]

--

**March 2025** 

With deeply realized acknowledgement of historical systems of oppression, please lift and support **BIPOC in Fiber** instead of me: [https://www.bipocinfiber.com/][3]

Hi loves.  I'm Stace (they/them) a.k.a. Soshin 宗心 (given Japanese dharma name that means 'ancestral heart'), a Zen Buddhist nonbinary pan LGBTQ+ knit and crochet original design enthusiast and rookie in roller derby who lives with my heart-of-gold husband and our rescue bonded pair of puppos in a charming Hudson River valley town in serene upstate NY.

Professionally I've been honored to have worked for two well-known yarn artists while living in Brooklyn--knit installation artist **Magda Sayeg** (founder of Knitta Please) and crochet installation artist **Olek** (a.k.a. Agata Oleksiak).

One who has taken a personal vow to dedicate their life to alleviating the suffering of others is a bodhisattva.  I am a bodhisattva.
[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bodhisattva][5]

Alpaca and wool fibers used are always **mulesing-free** exclusively from animal rescues and sanctuaries and primarily Buddhist nations, with a preference for plant-based over essentially anything synthetic.

**YOU are my Pattern Testers.**
Ideally every pattern will have three test projects minimum.
Post a pattern's first Project Page with any/all constructive criticism for any of my designs to **earn three complimentary paid patterns of your choice**, a pattern's second Project Page earns two paid patterns, and a pattern's third earns one.
Simply point me to your page when ready with mention of which patterns you'd like to receive, since Designers do not receive notifications when your Projects for our Patterns are posted.

**YOU are my crowdsourced pattern Tech Editors.**
It is simple as can be: receive $10 from me via Paypal or Venmo for any pattern edit you suggest that I implement--for any pattern here ever--with your Ravelry username credit under 'Tech Edits' in the Notes field of the pattern page.
Message me with an edit suggestion and I'll let you know if it is a change I will make. 
To date $50 USD total has been paid out for five edits that a few here have wisely suggested.
Thank you, five crowdsourced Tech Editors! You rock.

Feel free to message me anytime with questions that aren't Google-able.

Warmly,
Stace a.k.a. Zonal (they/them)


  [1]: https://indiesellersguild.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/isg-holiday-2022-5x7-2-1024x742.png
  [2]: https://www.indiesellersguild.org
  [3]: https://bipocinfiber.com
  [5]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bodhisattva

1299682.name: Port-Pillow Seatbelt Cover
1299682.gauge_description: 4 stitches and 3 rows = 1 inch in 4 HDC x 3 Rows
1299682.notes_html:
This pattern will help you to crochet a small Port-Pillow Seatbelt Cover that fastens around your seatbelt to keep it off of your port-a-cath. A port-a-cath is a device used to draw blood and give treatments, including intravenous fluids, blood transfusions, chemotherapy, and other drugs. It is also used for taking blood samples. A port-a-cath may stay in place for a long time and helps reduce the need for repeated needle sticks. These port-a-caths offer many benefits, however one of the down-sides is that it can get caught on everyday items such as seatbelts and other straps that go across the chest.

Materials Needed:
Yarn: Worsted weight #4 Yarn
Hook: 5.00mm
Poly-fil Fiber Stuffing
Blunt Needle (for weaving in ends)
Scissors
2 Buttons
4 Stitch Markers
1299682.notes:
*This pattern will help you to crochet a small Port-Pillow Seatbelt Cover that fastens around your seatbelt to keep it off of your port-a-cath.  A port-a-cath is a device used to draw blood and give treatments, including intravenous fluids, blood transfusions, chemotherapy, and other drugs.  It is also used for taking blood samples.  A port-a-cath may stay in place for a long time and helps reduce the need for repeated needle sticks.  These port-a-caths offer many benefits, however one of the down-sides is that it can get caught on everyday items such as seatbelts and other straps that go across the chest.*

**Materials Needed:**
**Yarn:** Worsted weight #4 Yarn
**Hook:** 5.00mm
**Poly-fil Fiber Stuffing
Blunt Needle (for weaving in ends)
Scissors
2 Buttons
4 Stitch Markers**

7348475.name: Amputee Chicken Sock
7348475.gauge_description: 0 stitches  = 4 inches in designed for any size
7348475.notes_html:
If amputee is below the knee you want the sock about 14+ in. long Sizes may vary.
If amputee is above the knee you will want to make it shorter.
If you want if wider be sure to work in multiples of 6.

Remember to be creative and use any color you want.

Don’t forget to stuff the bottom leg and foot.
7348475.notes:
If amputee is below the knee you want the sock about 14+ in. long Sizes may vary. 
If amputee is above the knee you will want to make it shorter.
If you want if wider be sure to work in multiples of 6.  

Remember to be creative and use any color you want.  

Don’t forget to stuff the bottom leg and foot.

7383175.name: Cat Inhaler Spacer Mask Cover
7383175.notes_html:
This pattern was made for my boy, Ragnar, who has been suffering from dermatitis and loss of fur because of the silicone mask. I hope it helps your pet as much as it has already helped him. <3

Materials:
3mm crochet hook
Bernat Velvet Yarn
I used the color: light yellow.
Tapestry Needle
Scissors

Finished Size:
Bernat Velvet Yarn
3.55x2.4 (WxL)

Please do not sell the finished product. These mask covers are designed to help our asthmatic furry friends who suffer from dermatitis from the silicone masks on the spacers. I do not want this product used for profit. This is protected by the copyright of this pattern.

Crochet Cat Inhaler Spacer Mask Cover © 2024 by Hooked Honeybee is licensed under CC BY-NC-ND 4.0. To view a copy of this license, visit https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/

7418437.name: Awesome Breastform KNIT
7418437.sizes_available: A, B, C, D, DD, E
7418437.notes_html:
An Awesome Breastform is a cotton breast prosthetic designed to be worn inside the wearer’s bra. The form is knit in
one piece, in the round. The back of the form is indented so that it stands away from the chest wall and doesn’t irritate
the wearer’s scar. A slit and flap is knit into the form so that the wearer can remove or insert additional stuffing.

Sizes: A (B, C, D, DD, E) - First number given is for size A (others are in parentheses). If only one number is
given, then use that for all sizes.

Gauge: While no gauge is given, the resulting fabric should be smooth and firm, but not stiff. When stuffed, your form
should not allow stuffing to show through.
7418437.notes:
An Awesome Breastform is a cotton breast prosthetic designed to be worn inside the wearer’s bra. The form is knit in
one piece, in the round. The back of the form is indented so that it stands away from the chest wall and doesn't irritate
the wearer's scar. A slit and flap is knit into the form so that the wearer can remove or insert additional stuffing.

**Sizes**: A (B, C, D, DD, E) - First number given is for size A (others are in parentheses). If only one number is
given, then use that for all sizes.

**Gauge**: While no gauge is given, the resulting fabric should be smooth and firm, but not stiff. When stuffed, your form
should not allow stuffing to show through.

packs.yarn_name: Hobby Lobby I Love This Cotton!

users.about_me:
Awesome Breastforms were created by a group of women who have come together for the single purpose of crocheting and knitting handmade prosthetic breast forms for women who have had breast surgery, including mastectomy, lumpectomy, explant surgery and women with developmental conditions. Many in the group know firsthand the devastating effects of breast surgery. Our forms are made of high quality 100% cotton fiber yarn. They are cooler, lighter and much more comfortable than traditional silicone prosthetics. 

Awesome Breastforms are made by caring volunteers and always given away free. 

***Please do not use our patterns to sell them***. 

These patterns have been developed and tested based on feedback from thousands of our recipients. 

Due to the increase in demand, and the difficulties of being able to fulfill the demand, our group has decided to release both the Knit and the Crochet pattern to the public.  We want to help more women, and feel that more can be helped by their friends or loved ones that can knit and crochet, than by just our group alone. 

We will have volunteers that are available to make forms for you or your loved one if you do not have someone that can make them for you.  Please visit our website at [www.awesomebreastforms.org][1] to place an order for your forms.  

Awesome Breastforms are washable and easy to care for.  When you place an Awesome Breastform in your bra, you will be surprised at how similar it feels to a natural breast.  In fact, many women say they soon forget they are wearing them!
You deserve your curves!

Our breast forms are completely free to any woman who has had a mastectomy or lumpectomy.  Volunteers pay the cost of yarn, lovingly give their time to produce the forms and then pay for all shipping expenses.  Unlike other groups, we do not accept monetary donations.  All we ask is that you share our website information with others who may also be in need.

Thank you for allowing us to give you back your curves!


  [1]: www.awesomebreastforms.org

7422423.name: Pull CB25-16
7422423.notes_html: Laissez-vous séduire par ce pull layette à pois ! Confectionné dans notre pelote de laine spéciale layette, la Mérino Baby, il protégera bébé du froid pour toutes les occasions. Disponible de 0 à 4 ans, ce modèle ravira les petits et les plus grands. Ce modèle est davantage à destination des tricoteurs confirmés. Pour réaliser ce modèle de tricot facile pour bébé il vous suffit de télécharger les explications sur notre site, de choisir vos coloris préférés et de vous munir de vos aiguilles n°3,5.

7422525.name: Top manches longues évasées
7422525.gauge_description: 14 stitches and 20 rows = 4 inches in Jersey
7422525.notes_html:
Ce top féminin et élégant se distingue par ses manches longues légèrement évasées, qui lui donnent une belle touche bohème. Tricoté en jersey, il se construit à plat de bas en haut, avec le devant et le dos identiques, puis les manches sont reprises autour des emmanchures et tricotées en rond. C’est un modèle simple mais raffiné, parfait pour les tricoteur·euses de niveau intermédiaire.

Tailles disponibles :
S (M, L)
Tour de poitrine : 87 (94, 100) cm
Tour de taille : 75 (80, 86) cm
Tour de bras : 25 (28, 31) cm
Longueur du top : 48 cm

Échantillon :
10 x 10 cm = 14 mailles x 20 rangs en jersey avec des aiguilles 7 mm

Matériel :
• 2,5 pelotes de fil 80 % acrylique / 20 % laine (environ 100g/170m)
• Aiguilles 7 mm (droites et circulaires)
• Marqueurs, compteur de rangs, mètre

Techniques utilisées :
• Tricot en jersey
• Diminutions (2 mailles ensemble)
• Augmentations (jeté tricoté torse pour éviter les trous)
• Tricot en rond pour les manches

Niveau : Intermédiaire

Un projet rapide et agréable à tricoter, qui ajoute une pièce unique et confortable à votre garde-robe. Ce top se marie parfaitement avec un jean taille haute ou une jupe fluide !
